back pain: Cat-Cow Stretch: Get on your hands and knees. Arch your back upwards like a cat, hold for 5 seconds, then dip it down while lifting your head. Repeat 10 times.
Child’s Pose: Kneel on the floor and sit back on your heels. Stretch arms forward on the ground and hold for 20–30 seconds.
neck pain: Neck Tilts: Tilt your head toward one shoulder and hold for 10 seconds. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Chin Tucks: Sit or stand upright. Pull your chin straight back (like making a double chin) and hold for 5 seconds.
knee pain: Quad Sets: Sit with your leg straight. Tighten your thigh muscle and hold for 5 seconds.
Straight Leg Raise: Lie on your back, bend one knee and keep the other leg straight. Raise the straight leg to the height of the bent knee, hold for 5 seconds.
shoulder pain: Pendulum Stretch: Lean forward and let your arm dangle. Move it in small circles clockwise and counterclockwise.
Wall Climb: Stand in front of a wall and walk your fingers up slowly until you feel a stretch.
ankle sprain: Ankle Circles: Sit with leg extended. Rotate ankle clockwise and counterclockwise 10 times.
Towel Stretch: Sit with legs extended. Wrap towel around the foot and gently pull it toward you. Hold for 15 seconds.
